meanings.definition: Present participle of debut: to make a first appearance or performance.
meanings.sent1: The young singer was debuting on stage for the first time.
meanings.sent2: The new movie will be debuting in theaters next week.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was debuting its tricks to an audience of delighted children.
meanings.sent4: The sun debuting over the horizon, casting a warm glow on the land.
meanings.sent5: The rocket debuting into the sky, leaving a trail of smoke behind.

meanings.definition: Present participle of debut: to introduce or present for the first time.
meanings.sent1: The chef was debuting his signature dish at the food festival.
meanings.sent2: The company will be debuting their latest product at the trade show.
meanings.sent3: The magician was debuting a new trick that left everyone amazed.
meanings.sent4: The artist debuting a masterpiece that captured the essence of nature.
meanings.sent5: The author debuting a novel that took readers on a thrilling journey.
